section.title: mda BeatBox
section.para: A port of mda's BeatBox drum-replacer plug-in.

Contains three samples (kick, snare and hat) designed to be triggered by incoming audio in three frequency ranges. The plug-in has built-in drum sounds based on the Roland CR-78 but these can be replaced by the (advanced) user.

To record your own sounds, use the Record control to monitor the plug's input, then with the source stopped select the slot to record into, play your sound, then with the source stopped again, switch back to monitoring.

entry.para: Trigger threshold level (the level that will trigger hi-hat playback).
Maximum trigger rate. Higher values will result in more rapid hi-hat triggering.
Trigger threshold level (the level that will trigger kick playback).

The frequency that will trigger kick playback. When adjusting this value, the machine will switch to "key listen" mode, so you can listen to filtered output and decided on the value that best represents your particular audio source.
Trigger threshold level (the level that will trigger snare playback).

The frequency that will trigger snare playback. When adjusting this value, the machine will switch to "key listen" mode, so you can listen to filtered output and decided on the value that best represents your particular audio source.
Apply input signal level variations to output.

listitem.para: Monitor - listen to input signal (return to this setting after making a recording).
->Hat - record input signal into hi-hat sample.
->Kick - record input signal into kick sample.
->Snare - record input signal into snare sample.

entry.para: Allow some of the input signal to be mixed with the output.
